books.title: The Portrait of a Lady
books.author: Henry James
books.summary: A young American woman travelling through Europe excites both admiration and intrigue.

books.title: White Fang
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A wild half-wolf survives a harsh existence before finding love and domestication in civilization.

books.title: The Enormous Room
books.author: E. E. Cummings
books.summary: E. E. Cummings describes the experiences of his and his fellow inmates’ imprisonment during World War I.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Coral Island
books.author: R. M. Ballantyne
books.summary: Three shipwrecked youths encounter delights and dangers as they attempt to escape their uninhabited tropical island paradise.

books.title: Kipps
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: An orphan raised by his aunt and uncle struggles as a young man to integrate into upper class society after receiving a substantial inheritance from his grandfather.

books.title: An Ideal Husband
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: Over the course of twenty-four hours, a blackmail plot threatens to bring down a member of the British aristocracy.

books.title: Vathek
books.author: William Beckford
books.summary: A powerful caliph embarks on a quest to harness the powers of darkness.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: A collection of J. Sheridan Le Fanu’s short fiction, including some of his famous ghost stories, gothic horror and sensation.

books.title: Ghost Stories
books.author: E. F. Benson
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories by E. F. Benson.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: A collection of Henry David Thoreau’s essays.

books.title: The Bellamy Trial
books.author: Frances Noyes Hart
books.summary: A man and a woman are on trial for the murder of his wife, her friend.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: The Communist Manifesto
books.author: Karl Marx
books.summary: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels’ classic analysis of modern industrial society and call for Working Class revolution.

books.title: The Luzumiyat
books.author: Abu al-ʻAlaʼ al-Maʻarri
books.summary: A collection of quatrains by Abu al-ʻAlaʼ al-Maʻarri.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: Search the Sky
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A man visits several worlds as he attempts to discover why humanity is dying out.

books.title: In the Midst of Life
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A collection of Ambrose Bierce’s American Civil War stories, psychological dramas, and satirical tales.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: Letters Written During a Short Residence in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Mary Wollstonecraft’s account of her travels through Scandinavia.
